_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Frozen Cakes, Pies, and Other Pastries Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



- Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, is strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This commitment is inherent to our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with our regulated process. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible accidental releases of regulated substances. However, if such an accidental release does occur, we are coordinated with the Atlanta FD Station 12 and the Dekalb County Local Emergency Planning Committee for emergency response support.





- The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled



Presently Anhydrous Ammonia is the only RMP regulated substance present at this facility above a threshold quantity.  Ammonia is utilized as the primary cooling media in our closed-loop refrigeration system. The system's purpose is to provide refrigeration and cold storage capabilities for SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, operations.  Due to the size and characteristics of our ammonia refrigeration systems, as well as Process Safety Management (PSM) applicability, SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, is covered under Program 3 of the RMP regulations.



- Offsite Consequence Analysis 



The Worst Case Release Scenario(s) and the Alternative Release Scenario(s), including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for each reported scenario have been completed as stated in Sections 2 and 3 of the RMP*eSubmit document.



To evaluate both the worst case, and alternative release off site consequence analysis, EPA's RMP Comp Hazardous Release software was utilized exclusively. As specified in the RMP Guidance, the worst case and alternate case release scenarios have been calculated and the results of the calculations are document

ed in the SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, RMP Plan on file at the facility.  Public and environmental receptors that could possibly be affected by the release scenarios were determined through the use of data from the 2010 US Census Bureau in MARPLOT mapping system software.



- General Accidental Release Prevention Program 



SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, has taken all necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  To meet these necessary requirements SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, has implemented their Process Safety Management program through the written guidelines stated in the OSHA PSM Standard, 29 CFR 1910.119. 



- Accident History



In the past five years, SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, has experienced one accidental release of ammonia that resulted in on site and/or off site impacts and that required reporting.  This information is included in Section 6 of the RMP Submit.



- Emergency Action/Response Plan



SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, current Emergency Response Plan focuses on evacuation of the facility in the event of an ammonia emergency.  SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, works closely with the Atlanta FD Station 12.  The written plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within the facility that would require modified procedures.



- Planned Changes to Improve Safety:



SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, currently has no changes planned for the ammonia refrigeration processes at this time.   However, the processes will be subjected to periodic process hazard analysis reviews for the purpose of identifying potential hazards and implementing the necessary improvement to provide a safer system. SFC Global Supply Chain, Inc. - Atlanta, GA, personnel will also periodically review all potential opportunities to improve the safety of our personnel, the surrounding communi
ty, and the ammonia refrigeration processes.
